. This is a very generic hierarchical inspector that is used in several places throughout the Dolphin development system. Because it is a very powerful tool you should be careful in the way that you use it so as to avoid unduly damaging your
. Here are a few suggestions you can follow to avoid getting into trouble:

li.text: tab (if it is available) rather than the
tab when setting property values. Most of the time this will give you an editing facility that is tailored the property you are modifying.
Don't use the drag and drop facility that is available in the left-hand properties pane. You might inadvertently drop something where you don't want it.
Avoid using the Set to Nil command in the context menu of the properties pane.
If you are a beginner you might find that is worth saving your image before altering any options settings so that if you do any damage you always have a backup to go back to.
